meanings.definition: To strike repeatedly, typically with the fists
meanings.sent1: He pummelled the punching bag in the gym.
meanings.sent2: The boxer pummelled his opponent in the ring.
meanings.sent3: The little boy pummelled the pillow pretending it was a monster.
meanings.sent4: The rain pummelled the roof all night long.
meanings.sent5: The waves pummelled the shore during the storm.

meanings.definition: To beat or thrash with force
meanings.sent1: She pummelled the dough to make it soft for baking.
meanings.sent2: The strong wind pummelled the trees in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The chef pummelled the steak to tenderize it before cooking.
meanings.sent4: The hail pummelled the car, leaving dents all over.
meanings.sent5: The hammer pummelled the nail into the wood.
